intro: Xysmalobium carsonii, commonly known as Carson's fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces showy, orange to yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
